channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024040486
item.description:
Report X-2024040486

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2x 2.5-gallon plastic bottles of convo clean 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of convo clean had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from bottle. Package had plastic bags no slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of convo clean had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040452
item.description:
Report X-2024040452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload, upon inspection one of the two bottles had a loose cap and leaked inside and outside of the package. DescribePack: 1 Gallon bottle had a loose cap, which leaked even though it had a plastic bag on it for extra security. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin and taken to QA where it was contained in the QA hazmat cage and processed.

item.title: Report X-2024040448
item.description:
Report X-2024040448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat pkg came down QA01 belt from the unload. Noticed a wet spot on the bottom of the box. I grabbed my PPE and put the damaged hazmat pkg in a red hazardous waste bin for inspection. DescribePack: One of the bottle have a puncture hole on the bottom of the bottle, it was leaking out slowly DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: The bottle with the puncture hole on the bottom of the bottle had to be placed upside down to prevent any more liquid leaking out.

item.title: Report X-2024040470
item.description:
Report X-2024040470

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler found the package while van was being unloaded. Package handler noticed it was wet, alerted manager, and manager brought to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The lids appeared ok on both bottles but the body of one bottle was dented. Could not be positive what caused the leak or where it was coming from. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bin and brought to Qa.

DescribePack: caps loosened off of bottles and liquid leaked out DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside a hazardous materials bag to prevent liquid from leaking more onto the floor or other packages.

item.title: Report X-2024040433
item.description:
Report X-2024040433

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found by the load side manager. The box had a code 10 on it and it smelled really strong. Upon inspection, one of the bottles cap was loose and its inner seal was broken causing it to leak. DescribePack: the cap was loose and inner seal broken. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed in a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2024040491
item.description:
Report X-2024040491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS LEAKING IN UNLOAD TRAILER AND GIVEN TO QA. QA OPENED BOX FOR INSEPCTION AND DISCOVERED IT TO BE A LARGE BATTERY. THE BATTERY WAS WRAPPED IN PLASTIC BUT THERE WAS A HOLE IN THE PLASTIC CAUSING THE SPILL TO FUTHER LEAK. DUE TO THE HAZARDOUS NATURE OF A BATTERY THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A SAVAGE DRUM DescribePack: SMALL HOLE IN PLASTIC COVEREING BATTERY. BATTERY ITSELF WAS WET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS SECURED IN DRUM IN THE CAGE

SPILLING HAZMAT WAS CONTAINED IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND HAZMAT PROCEDURES WERE STARTED DescribePack: LID ON 1 OF THE GALLONS WAS LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT PROCEDURE, PLACED IN HAZ TOTE AND PUT IN HAZ CAGE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA because it was wet on the bottom. Originally it seemed that something may have spilled on it but upon further inspection, the bottle had a very slight leak. DescribePack: The pail's closures were fine and could not pin point were the puncture was but when placed on a dry surface it became wet over time. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a hazmat bag and pail and kept separate from other boxes.

item.title: Report I-2024040037
item.description:
Report I-2024040037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN QUESTION OUT ON THE RESPONDER CHANNEL RESPONDER PROPERLY CONTAINED AND CLEANED UP THE SPILLED AREA BEFORE TRANSPORTING PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP ONCE AT THE DMR THE PACKAGE HAD NO OUTSIDE MARKINGS OR INDICATORS OF IT BEING A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SO THE RESPONDER BEGAN PROCESS THE LEAKING PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS NOT IN THE SYSTEM SO IT NEEDED TO BE GREEN BAGGED, DURING THE SOLIDIFICATION PROCESS, THE STRONG ODOR BECAME APPARENT. WHEN ASKED FOR INGREDIENTS, WE FOUND THE SDS OF THE PRODUCT(MARYKATE ON AND OFF HULL& BOTTOM CLEANER) IN QUESTION AND TURNED OUT TO BE A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE. WE IMMDIATELY STOPPED PROCESSING AND CALLED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER TO REPORT THE PACKAGE. PART VII- RECOMMENDATIONS/ACTIONS TAKEN TO PREVENT RECURRENCE
